lines.content: ## List of features in Soccat Version 1.0:
1. Ensure you have `Java-11` installed on your computer
2. Download the `Soccat.jar` from the project GitHub
3. Copy the jar file to your desired folder
4. Open a command prompt in the same directory as the jar file
5. Run `java -jar Soccat.jar` to run the application.
* The format of the commands must be followed
* The parameter of the commands must be entered in sequence
* Only modify the data file after exiting the program
Adds a todo task to the list of tasks.
* The task will be displayed after being successfully added.
* Tasks will automatically be saved in the task file after this operation.
Got it. I've added this todo:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a deadline task to the list of tasks.
* The task will be displayed after being successfully added.
* Tasks will automatically be saved in the task file after this operation.
Got it. I've added this deadline:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds an event task to the list of tasks.
* The task will be displayed after being successfully added.
* Tasks will automatically be saved in the task file after this operation.
Got it. I've added this event:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
List all the tasks currently stored in the task file.
Attempts to find tasks in which the name contains the keyword.
* This command will return a list of questions that match the query.
* The index of the tasks returned corresponds to their original index,
similar to their index in the `list` command.
Example: `find Quiz` or `find qUiZ` or `find quiz`
Marks a task as done based on the provided **1-based task index**.
* The task index could be found using the previous `list` or `find` command.
* Tasks will automatically be saved in the task file after this operation.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
### Marking a task as not done: `unmark`
Marks a task as not done based on the provided **1-based task index**.
* The task index could be found using the previous `list` or `find` command.
* Tasks will automatically be saved in the task file after this operation.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Deletes a task from the task file based on the provided **1-based task index**.
* The task index could be found using the previous `list` or `find` command.
* Tasks will automatically be saved in the task file after this operation.
Noted, I have removed this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
### Editing tasks stored in the data file
The data would be stored in the following format
An example of the file is as follows:
You may edit the file to edit or add tasks of your choosing as well.
public static final String INVALID_PROMPT = "Oops, your command is not recognized, please try again!";
public abstract boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Represents a command to add a deadline.
* consisting of a deadline with a task and deadline.
public static final String INVALID_PROMPT = "Oops, please try deadline <task> /by <deadline>!";
* Executes the deadline command to add a deadline task
* to the list of tasks, and update the storage file.
* @param tasks The taskList object containing tasks
* @param ui The ui object to display messages to users
* @param taskFile The storage file for tasks to be stored
* @return Boolean of whether to exit the application.
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage taskFile) {
* Represents a command to delete a task.
* pointing to an integer taskIndex to be deleted.
public static final String INVALID_PROMPT = "Oops, please try delete <taskIndex>!";
* Executes the delete command to remove a task from
* the list of tasks as well as the task file.
* @param tasks The taskList object containing tasks from which the task is removed
* @param ui The ui object to display messages to users
* @param taskFile The storage file from which the task is removed
* @return Boolean of whether to exit the application.
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage taskFile) {
* Represents a command to add an event.
* consisting of an event with a task, start and end.
public static final String INVALID_PROMPT = "Oops, please try event <task> /from <start> /to <end>!";
public EventCommand(String taskName, String from, String to) {
